English.Text: Your familiarity with the Teutonic dynasties stands you in good stead. Whispers at home are growing ever louder on the subject the Queen's suitors, and her cousin Ernest seems to be one of the front-runners. You visit the outspoken prince consort at his ivy-clad burg, and having presented a letter Sir Archibald gave you, he nods and leads you through its low, rib-vaulted ceilings, past gilt-candelabras and canvas portraits. Though cordial, Prince Ernest seems a little twitchy.
